hints_html:
Put y1 and y2 in a vector like this

\[\begin{aligned} \mathbf{y} = \begin{bmatrix} y_1 \\ y_2 \end{bmatrix}\end{aligned}\]

Now the given equation is just a linear system with coefficient matrix A.
hints_raw:
Put ''y<sub>1</sub>'' and ''y<sub>2</sub>'' in a vector like this
:<math>
\mathbf{y} = \begin{bmatrix} y_1 \\ y_2 \end{bmatrix}
</math>
Now the given equation is just a linear system with coefficient matrix ''A''.
question: B 06 (a)
statement_html:
Consider the system of linear differential equations given by

\[\begin{aligned} y'_{1}(t) &= 3y_{1}(t) - 2y_{2}(t)\\ y'_{2}(t) &= 4y_{1}(t) - y_{2}(t)\end{aligned}\]

Express this system in the form of \(y'(t) = Ay(t)\)
statement_raw:
Consider the system of linear differential equations given by 

<math>
\begin{align}
y'_{1}(t) &= 3y_{1}(t) - 2y_{2}(t)\\
y'_{2}(t) &= 4y_{1}(t) - y_{2}(t)
\end{align}
</math>

Express this system in the form of <math> y'(t) = Ay(t) </math>
